snippet.title: Rogue gameplay
snippet.description:
Some footage of the game that coined the genre "Roguelike".

Run in Windows 98 Second Edition (Microsoft Virtual PC)


********
Rogue is a dungeon crawling video game first developed by Michael Toy and Glenn Wichman around 1980. It is generally credited with being the first "graphical" adventure game, and was a favorite on college Unix systems in the early to mid-1980s, in part due to the procedural generation of game content. Rogue popularized dungeon crawling as a video game trope, leading others to develop a class of derivatives known collectively as "roguelikes". For example, it directly inspired Hack, which in turn led to NetHack. Roguelikes have since influenced commercial games outside the genre, such as Diablo.
********


******** Description courtesy of Wikipedia.org c. 2010

You may have come here expecting not to listen to "Puff the Magic Dragon". You have been misled.
